title: Analysis of Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions for NRG Energy Inc

content.text: NRG Energy Inc is formed through a merger between National Energy Group and Unicom Corp.
NRG Energy acquires Texas Genco for $5.8 billion, creating one of the largest competitive power generation companies in the United States.
NRG Energy announces a 2-for-1 stock split, doubling the number of shares outstanding.
NRG Energy acquires Dynegy's ownership interest in Dynegy Midstream Services LP, gaining control of natural gas storage and transportation assets.
NRG Energy announces a 3-for-2 stock split, increasing the number of shares by 50%.
NRG Energy completes the acquisition of Texas-based Reliant Energy's retail business and certain power plants.
NRG Energy announces a 2-for-1 stock split, doubling the existing shares.
NRG Energy acquires the retail operations of Reliant Energy, expanding its retail customer base.
